conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_A because I value a rigorous academic environment and I’m ready to contribute strongly to the school community. I would be excited to accept an offer from School_A and commit to the program if admitted.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C ranks me 4th (behind B, C, D). With capacity 1, I’m unlikely to win School_C if higher-priority students apply. I have strongest relative priority at School_A and School_B where I am ranked 1st. School_A is my 3rd choice (better than risking ending up much lower), so I should secure a high-probability match early by applying to School_A, where acceptance is very likely if they follow their priority list.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your application and for sharing your interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A. We look forward to having you join our community and contribute to our rigorous academic environment.
conversation.thought: Student_E is my top true-priority candidate (#1). They have applied directly to School_A in round 1, and I have remaining quota 1. Accepting now secures my highest-priority match and there is no benefit to waiting since no student ranks above Student_E on my list.

conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions team—I'm Student_B. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the academic environment and opportunities your school offers. I would be thrilled to enroll if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, but School_A ranks me 4th (behind E, D, A) for only 1 seat, so acceptance is unlikely if those students apply. School_C ranks me 1st, giving me the best chance to secure a high-preference outcome early. I will apply to School_C to lock in a strong match rather than risk being rejected later after others fill seats.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and your interest in School_C. We’re pleased to offer you admission—your profile is an excellent fit for our community. Please confirm that you’d like to enroll at School_C, and we’ll share the next steps.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_B is #1 on School_C's true priority list. We have quota 1 and no other applicants in this round. Accepting now secures our top-choice student and avoids the risk of losing them to School_A or School_B, which Student_B ranks above School_C. Therefore, accept immediately.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions committee—I'm Student_D and School_B is my first choice. I’m very excited about the academic environment and would be ready to commit immediately if admitted. I believe I would contribute positively and take full advantage of the opportunities at School_B. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me 4th, early application is still my best chance because other students (A and C) also rank School_B highly and could take the only seat if I wait. I will emphasize strong fit and commitment to encourage acceptance if they can choose among applicants.

conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing applications in this round and given our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your consideration and wish you the very best in the process.
conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and true priority order is E > B > C > D > A. In this round, I received APPLY from C, D, and A. Among these, Student_C is ranked higher than Student_D on my list. Since accepting Student_D now would fill my only seat and prevent matching with a higher-priority applicant (Student_C) who is already applying, I should reject Student_D. Student_D prefers School_B first, but that does not outweigh my priority objective given the immediate availability of a higher-ranked candidate.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_C and I’m formally applying because School_B is my first-choice school. I’m highly motivated to enroll and would commit immediately if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true preference is School_B. Given full information, School_B’s priority list ranks me (Student_C) 3rd, behind Student_E and Student_B. Student_E’s top choice is School_C (not School_B), so School_B’s main competition is Student_B, who ranks School_B 2nd but ranks School_A 1st and may apply there first. To maximize my chance at my top choice before others lock in, I should apply to School_B immediately in round 1 with a clear, committed message.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. We appreciate your commitment and look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I have APPLY messages from D, C, and A. Among these, Student_C is the highest on my list. Although Student_E and Student_B are ranked above C, neither has contacted me this round; moreover, Student_E ranks School_B last and Student_B ranks School_A first, so the likelihood they apply to me soon is low. With quota 1, accepting C now secures a relatively high-priority match and avoids the risk of ending with a lower-priority student or an unfilled seat later. I already rejected D; between C and A, C is preferred. Therefore, accept Student_C.

conversation.message: Dear School_B admissions committee, I’m Student_A and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly value your academic environment and would be excited to contribute to the community. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying only increases the chance it fills with higher-priority students (especially Student_B/Student_C/Student_D who all rank School_B highly). An early application is my best shot to secure my first choice before capacity is taken.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. At this time, we have filled our available seat and are not able to offer you admission.

We appreciate your consideration and wish you the very best in your placement process.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_A applied to School_B. However, School_B has quota 1 and has already accepted/matched with Student_C this round (remaining quota 0). Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any APPLY. Even aside from capacity, Student_A is lowest on School_B’s true priority list, while Student_C is ranked higher and already matched, so we should not attempt to displace the current match.

conversation.message: Dear School_E Admissions Committee, I’m Student_D. School_E is one of my top remaining choices, and I’m applying because I believe I would be a strong fit for your community and would take full advantage of your academic and extracurricular opportunities. If admitted, I’m prepared to commit promptly and enthusiastically. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Only School_D and School_E remain unmatched. On my true preference list, School_E is ranked above School_D, so I should prioritize applying to School_E now rather than risk losing it. I will send a clear, commitment-oriented application highlighting fit and readiness to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_E. After reviewing our current applicant pool and available capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate the time and care you put into your application, and we wish you the very best with your remaining options.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: School_E has quota 1 and true priority ranks Student_D last (A, C, B, E, D). This round, Student_A (our top choice) also applied. Since accepting Student_D now would fill our only seat and prevent matching with a higher-priority student, we should reject Student_D and keep capacity for Student_A. Student_D also ranks School_E 4th, suggesting weaker mutual fit compared to alternatives.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_A and I would like to formally apply to School_E. While my earlier top choices are no longer available, School_E remains a school I genuinely want to attend because I value the community and the opportunities your program offers. If admitted, I would be excited to commit and contribute fully.

Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_A
conversation.thought: Only School_D and School_E remain unmatched. On my true preference list, School_E (4th) is preferred over School_D (5th). Also, School_E ranks me highest (1st) in its priority list, so an [APPLY] to School_E has a strong chance of immediate acceptance and secures a better outcome than waiting or applying to School_D.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your continued interest in School_E. After reviewing your application, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_E. We would be excited to have you join our community.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and Student_A is the top candidate on School_E’s true priority list. Student_A has applied, so accepting secures our best possible match immediately. Student_D has applied as well but is last on our priority list and was previously rejected; accepting Student_A dominates any alternative and avoids the risk of losing them to another school in later rounds.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_D and I would like to formally apply to School_D. I’m excited about the opportunity to join your community, and if admitted I’m ready to commit promptly and fully participate in both academics and school life. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_D
conversation.thought: Only School_D remains unmatched. It is on my true preference list (though last), and I prefer matching to being unmatched. With capacity 1 and School_D ranking me #1 in its priority list, a direct application should be accepted immediately. I will clearly state commitment and fit to secure the match.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application to School_D. After reviewing your submission, we are pleased to offer you admission. We would be excited to welcome you to our community and appreciate your readiness to commit and participate fully.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions Committee
conversation.thought: Student_D is the top-ranked candidate on School_D’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and are currently unmatched. Accepting Student_D immediately secures our best possible outcome; there is no higher-priority student to wait for, and delaying risks losing them to other schools they prefer more (School_B/School_C/School_A/School_E). Therefore, accept now.
